page.title: 15A FACTORY IN SOUTHTOWN
page.content: We visited one of the factories on {Harfrey's estate.}It is one of a number of factories that provide support for the North Sea oil and gas rigs. My father is a mechanical inspector at this factory. They make submarines, marine cameras and sonar fish. The factory is 12 years old and employs 150 people. There are many different jobs to be done such as welding, boring, milling, turning and electronics. The submarines they make are of different types. Some are manned while others are remotely operated. One submarine could cost Â£250,000. The factory has its own test pool which is 12 feet deep. The submarines are sold to oil companies, for oil rig repair and maintenance, salvage companies and the navy.
